ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

**ğŸš€ hashtag#Pharmacovigilance for Freshers | Part 1 â€“ Introduction to Pharmacovigilance & How to Get Started (2025)**Hello Future Drug Safety Champs!Are you ready to make your mark in the world of **Pharmacovigilance (PV)**?This is the field where **science meets patient safety** â€” and YOU could be the next rising star in it!hashtag#What is hashtag#Pharmacovigilance (PV)?Pharmacovigilance is defined as the science and activities concerned with the detection, assessment, understanding, and prevention of adverse effects or any other drug-related problems.hashtag#What Do PV Professionals Actually Do?**Hereâ€™s what your future self could be working on:**ğŸ” Monitor adverse drug reactions (ADR)âš ï¸ Detect drug safety signalsğŸ“‹ Prepare regulatory reports (FDA, EMA, CDSCO)ğŸ›¡ï¸ Minimize risk through safety strategiesâœ… Ensure global compliance### Who Can Get into PV?No rocket science here! If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small. hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

**ğŸš€ hashtag#Pharmacovigilance for Freshers | Part 1 â€“ Introduction to Pharmacovigilance & How to Get Started (2025)**Hello Future Drug Safety Champs!Are you ready to make your mark in the world of **Pharmacovigilance (PV)**?This is the field where **science meets patient safety** â€” and YOU could be the next rising star in it!hashtag#What is hashtag#Pharmacovigilance (PV)?Pharmacovigilance is defined as the science and activities concerned with the detection, assessment, understanding, and prevention of adverse effects or any other drug-related problems.hashtag#What Do PV Professionals Actually Do?**Hereâ€™s what your future self could be working on:**ğŸ” Monitor adverse drug reactions (ADR)âš ï¸ Detect drug safety signalsğŸ“‹ Prepare regulatory reports (FDA, EMA, CDSCO)ğŸ›¡ï¸ Minimize risk through safety strategiesâœ… Ensure global compliance### Who Can Get into PV?No rocket science here! If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small. Intern if needed.**Every ADR you code, every signal you detect builds your drug safety expertise.**Coming Soon: Part 2 â€“ Free Resources & Certifications for PV Beginners!**Comment **PV Ready** if you're excited!Share with a friend who needs this push!hashtag#PharmacovigilanceForFreshershashtag#DrugSafetyCareershashtag#LifeScienceJobshashtag#PVReady2025hashtag#PharmaJobshashtag#CareerInPharmacovigilancehashtag#FreshersGuidehashtag#HealthcareCareershashtag#ClinicalResearchCommunityhashtag#MedSafetyMattershashtag#CareerseriesbyAkanksha

hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

**ğŸš€ hashtag#Pharmacovigilance for Freshers | Part 1 â€“ Introduction to Pharmacovigilance & How to Get Started (2025)**Hello Future Drug Safety Champs!Are you ready to make your mark in the world of **Pharmacovigilance (PV)**?This is the field where **science meets patient safety** â€” and YOU could be the next rising star in it!hashtag#What is hashtag#Pharmacovigilance (PV)?Pharmacovigilance is defined as the science and activities concerned with the detection, assessment, understanding, and prevention of adverse effects or any other drug-related problems.hashtag#What Do PV Professionals Actually Do?**Hereâ€™s what your future self could be working on:**ğŸ” Monitor adverse drug reactions (ADR)âš ï¸ Detect drug safety signalsğŸ“‹ Prepare regulatory reports (FDA, EMA, CDSCO)ğŸ›¡ï¸ Minimize risk through safety strategiesâœ… Ensure global compliance### Who Can Get into PV?No rocket science here! If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small. Intern if needed.**Every ADR you code, every signal you detect builds your drug safety expertise.**Coming Soon: Part 2 â€“ Free Resources & Certifications for PV Beginners!**Comment **PV Ready** if you're excited!Share with a friend who needs this push!hashtag#PharmacovigilanceForFreshershashtag#DrugSafetyCareershashtag#LifeScienceJobshashtag#PVReady2025hashtag#PharmaJobshashtag#CareerInPharmacovigilancehashtag#FreshersGuidehashtag#HealthcareCareershashtag#ClinicalResearchCommunityhashtag#MedSafetyMattershashtag#CareerseriesbyAkanksha

hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small. Intern if needed.**Every ADR you code, every signal you detect builds your drug safety expertise.**Coming Soon: Part 2 â€“ Free Resources & Certifications for PV Beginners!**Comment **PV Ready** if you're excited!Share with a friend who needs this push!hashtag#PharmacovigilanceForFreshershashtag#DrugSafetyCareershashtag#LifeScienceJobshashtag#PVReady2025hashtag#PharmaJobshashtag#CareerInPharmacovigilancehashtag#FreshersGuidehashtag#HealthcareCareershashtag#ClinicalResearchCommunityhashtag#MedSafetyMattershashtag#CareerseriesbyAkanksha

hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small. hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

**ğŸš€ hashtag#Pharmacovigilance for Freshers | Part 1 â€“ Introduction to Pharmacovigilance & How to Get Started (2025)**Hello Future Drug Safety Champs!Are you ready to make your mark in the world of **Pharmacovigilance (PV)**?This is the field where **science meets patient safety** â€” and YOU could be the next rising star in it!hashtag#What is hashtag#Pharmacovigilance (PV)?Pharmacovigilance is defined as the science and activities concerned with the detection, assessment, understanding, and prevention of adverse effects or any other drug-related problems.hashtag#What Do PV Professionals Actually Do?**Hereâ€™s what your future self could be working on:**ğŸ” Monitor adverse drug reactions (ADR)âš ï¸ Detect drug safety signalsğŸ“‹ Prepare regulatory reports (FDA, EMA, CDSCO)ğŸ›¡ï¸ Minimize risk through safety strategiesâœ… Ensure global compliance### Who Can Get into PV?No rocket science here! If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small. Intern if needed.**Every ADR you code, every signal you detect builds your drug safety expertise.**Coming Soon: Part 2 â€“ Free Resources & Certifications for PV Beginners!**Comment **PV Ready** if you're excited!Share with a friend who needs this push!hashtag#PharmacovigilanceForFreshershashtag#DrugSafetyCareershashtag#LifeScienceJobshashtag#PVReady2025hashtag#PharmaJobshashtag#CareerInPharmacovigilancehashtag#FreshersGuidehashtag#HealthcareCareershashtag#ClinicalResearchCommunityhashtag#MedSafetyMattershashtag#CareerseriesbyAkanksha

hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small. Intern if needed.**Every ADR you code, every signal you detect builds your drug safety expertise.**Coming Soon: Part 2 â€“ Free Resources & Certifications for PV Beginners!**Comment **PV Ready** if you're excited!Share with a friend who needs this push!hashtag#PharmacovigilanceForFreshershashtag#DrugSafetyCareershashtag#LifeScienceJobshashtag#PVReady2025hashtag#PharmaJobshashtag#CareerInPharmacovigilancehashtag#FreshersGuidehashtag#HealthcareCareershashtag#ClinicalResearchCommunityhashtag#MedSafetyMattershashtag#CareerseriesbyAkanksha

hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small. Intern if needed.**Every ADR you code, every signal you detect builds your drug safety expertise.**Coming Soon: Part 2 â€“ Free Resources & Certifications for PV Beginners!**Comment **PV Ready** if you're excited!Share with a friend who needs this push!hashtag#PharmacovigilanceForFreshershashtag#DrugSafetyCareershashtag#LifeScienceJobshashtag#PVReady2025hashtag#PharmaJobshashtag#CareerInPharmacovigilancehashtag#FreshersGuidehashtag#HealthcareCareershashtag#ClinicalResearchCommunityhashtag#MedSafetyMattershashtag#CareerseriesbyAkanksha

hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

**ğŸš€ hashtag#Pharmacovigilance for Freshers | Part 1 â€“ Introduction to Pharmacovigilance & How to Get Started (2025)**Hello Future Drug Safety Champs!Are you ready to make your mark in the world of **Pharmacovigilance (PV)**?This is the field where **science meets patient safety** â€” and YOU could be the next rising star in it!hashtag#What is hashtag#Pharmacovigilance (PV)?Pharmacovigilance is defined as the science and activities concerned with the detection, assessment, understanding, and prevention of adverse effects or any other drug-related problems.hashtag#What Do PV Professionals Actually Do?**Hereâ€™s what your future self could be working on:**ğŸ” Monitor adverse drug reactions (ADR)âš ï¸ Detect drug safety signalsğŸ“‹ Prepare regulatory reports (FDA, EMA, CDSCO)ğŸ›¡ï¸ Minimize risk through safety strategiesâœ… Ensure global compliance### Who Can Get into PV?No rocket science here! If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small. Intern if needed.**Every ADR you code, every signal you detect builds your drug safety expertise.**Coming Soon: Part 2 â€“ Free Resources & Certifications for PV Beginners!**Comment **PV Ready** if you're excited!Share with a friend who needs this push!hashtag#PharmacovigilanceForFreshershashtag#DrugSafetyCareershashtag#LifeScienceJobshashtag#PVReady2025hashtag#PharmaJobshashtag#CareerInPharmacovigilancehashtag#FreshersGuidehashtag#HealthcareCareershashtag#ClinicalResearchCommunityhashtag#MedSafetyMattershashtag#CareerseriesbyAkanksha

hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small. hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

**ğŸš€ hashtag#Pharmacovigilance for Freshers | Part 1 â€“ Introduction to Pharmacovigilance & How to Get Started (2025)**Hello Future Drug Safety Champs!Are you ready to make your mark in the world of **Pharmacovigilance (PV)**?This is the field where **science meets patient safety** â€” and YOU could be the next rising star in it!hashtag#What is hashtag#Pharmacovigilance (PV)?Pharmacovigilance is defined as the science and activities concerned with the detection, assessment, understanding, and prevention of adverse effects or any other drug-related problems.hashtag#What Do PV Professionals Actually Do?**Hereâ€™s what your future self could be working on:**ğŸ” Monitor adverse drug reactions (ADR)âš ï¸ Detect drug safety signalsğŸ“‹ Prepare regulatory reports (FDA, EMA, CDSCO)ğŸ›¡ï¸ Minimize risk through safety strategiesâœ… Ensure global compliance### Who Can Get into PV?No rocket science here! If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small. Intern if needed.**Every ADR you code, every signal you detect builds your drug safety expertise.**Coming Soon: Part 2 â€“ Free Resources & Certifications for PV Beginners!**Comment **PV Ready** if you're excited!Share with a friend who needs this push!hashtag#PharmacovigilanceForFreshershashtag#DrugSafetyCareershashtag#LifeScienceJobshashtag#PVReady2025hashtag#PharmaJobshashtag#CareerInPharmacovigilancehashtag#FreshersGuidehashtag#HealthcareCareershashtag#ClinicalResearchCommunityhashtag#MedSafetyMattershashtag#CareerseriesbyAkanksha

hashtag#FreshStartTip â€“ Understanding Talent Acquisition vs. HRAs part of my small initiative to share whatever little I've learned in my career from the HR Tech industry so far, hereâ€™s a quick tip that might help freshers and those new to the corporate worldâ€”especially if you're exploring roles or networking in the HR Tech space.One of the most common mix-ups Iâ€™ve seen  is confusing Talent Acquisition with Human Resources (HR).While they work closely together, their core responsibilities are different:Talent Acquisition (TA) is all about:1. Sourcing, attracting & hiring top talent2. Planning future workforce needs3. Employer branding & recruitment marketingHuman Resources (HR) focuses on:1. Managing employees post-hire2. Handling payroll, policies, and compliance3. Driving engagement, growth, and retentionTA gets you in the door. HR helps you grow inside !! ğŸš€Understanding this can help you communicate more effectively and build stronger connections within the HR Tech community and broader professional network. !!If youâ€™ve had moments of mixing these up, donâ€™t worryâ€”weâ€™ve all been there. Letâ€™s keep learning and sharing!Hope this helps at least one person out thereâ€”thatâ€™s a win for me!hashtag#FreshStartTip hashtag#HRTech hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#CareerLearning hashtag#HelpingFreshers hashtag#PeopleOps hashtag#EntryLevelTips hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CustomerSuccess

ğŸ­ LinkedIn or Linke-done?Ever seen this?ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ A poised individual in formal attireğŸ¢ Big corporate logo in the backgroundğŸ“ Caption: "We're hiring freshers! Comment 'Interested' to get shortlisted!"But wait... where's the job description? The application link? The actual job?Welcome to the world of LinkedIn Modeling Agency, where:That smile isn't because you're hiredâ€”it's because you've just boosted someone's engagement metrics.Your "Interested" comment? It's not leading to a job; it's leading to a data collection spree.The Real Job? Data Collection SpecialistThese posts often lack:Specific job details.Legitimate application links.Any semblance of authenticity.Instead, they're fishing for:Your name.Your email.Your aspirations.All to later pitch you dubious courses or products.But It's Not Just About EngagementSome scams go further. For instance, certain fraudulent job postings have been linked to malware distribution. (Digit)Stay Sharp, Job SeekersBefore you comment "Interested":Verify the company's official job postings.Be wary of vague job descriptions.Never download unfamiliar apps or click on suspicious links.Remember, LinkedIn is a professional network, not a dating app. A pretty face doesn't guarantee a genuine opportunity.hashtag#Accenture hashtag#Deloitte hashtag#Amazon hashtag#Google hashtag#TCS hashtag#HCLTech hashtag#Wipro hashtag#Cognizant hashtag#Capgemini hashtag#IBM hashtag#Infosys hashtag#Oracle hashtag#DellTechnologies hashtag#Apple hashtag#NotHiringJustSmiling hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#FreshersBeware hashtag#PrettyPostNoPaycheck hashtag#DataFarming101 hashtag#FakeProfile

If you belong to:* B.Pharm / M.Pharm* B.Sc / M.Sc (Biotech, Microbio, Biochem)* MBBS / BDS* Diploma holders with a **certification in PV**Youâ€™re eligible to join the PV squad!---### Must-Have Skills to Shine in PV:âœ… Attention to detailâœ… Clear communication (written + verbal)âœ… Analytical mindsetâœ… Basic knowledge of regulations (FDA, EMA, ICH)âœ… Computer skills (databases, safety software)âœ… Understanding of clinical trials---### Kickstart Your PV Career in 4 Steps:**Step 1:** Learn the Basics* Understand ADRs, AEs, ICSR, PSUR* Read FDA, EMA, CDSCO, ICH guidelines**Step 2:** Upskill Online* Coursera, EdX â€“ Drug Safety courses* Pharmacovigilance Academy â€“ Free basics* RAPS â€“ Regulatory webinars**Step 3:** Apply for Entry-Level Roles* Pharmacovigilance Associate* Drug Safety Trainee* Clinical Safety Executive* Medical Review Coordinator**Step 4:** Ace the Interview* Know the terms (ICSR, signal detection, risk management)* Understand real-life PV cases---### Top Companies Hiring Freshers:âœ¨ IQVIAâœ¨ Parexelâœ¨ Cognizant Life Sciencesâœ¨ Accentureâœ¨ TCS (Life Sciences Division)âœ¨ PRA Health Sciencesâœ¨ Dr. Reddyâ€™sâœ¨ Fresenius Kabiâœ¨ Novartisâœ¨ Pharmalex### Pro Tip for Freshers:**Start small.
